contentrichtext.text: The '''Association of Free Democrats''' ({{lang-de|Bund Freier Demokraten}}) was a liberal coalition formed in [[East Germany]] on 12 February 1990. It originally consisted of the [[Liberal Democratic Party of Germany|Liberal Democratic Party]], the [[Free Democratic Party (GDR)]] and the [[German Forum Party]]. In the [[Volkskammer]] election of the 18 March 1990 the Association of Free Democrats polled 5.28% of the votes and gained 21 seats. It then participated in the last GDR government led by [[Lothar de MaiziÃ¨re]]. In 27 March 1990 the Association of Free Democrats absorbed the [[National Democratic Party of Germany (East Germany)|National Democratic Party of Germany]]. Finally, in 11 August 1990 it merged with the [[West Germany|West German]] [[Free Democratic Party of Germany|Free Democratic Party]]. ==See also== *[[Liberalism]] *[[Contributions to liberal theory]] *[[Liberalism worldwide]] *[[List of liberal parties]] *[[Liberal democracy]] *[[Liberalism in Germany]] ==External links== *[http://www.chronikderwende.de/english/term.jsp?key=E_BFD Association of Free Democrats from ''chronik der wende''] {{GDR political parties}} [[Category:Defunct liberal political parties|Germany 1990]] [[Category:Political parties in East Germany]] [[Category:Political parties established in 1990]] [[Category:Political parties disestablished in 1990]] [[Category:1990 establishments in East Germany]] [[Category:1990 disestablishments in East Germany]] {{Euro-liberalparty-stub}} {{Germany-party-stub}}
